text.p: Seitel Inc said Wednesday its 13th deep Yegua success in Wharton County, Texas, the Cox & Perkins Lange No. 2 well, is producing after testing 2.1 million cubic feet of natural gas and 180 barrels of oil per day from selective perforations at 9,369 to 9,405 feet; total depth drilled was 9,700 feet.

The Lange No. 2 well is expected to commercially produce at significantly higher rates than tested -- with stabilized flow anticipated to be 5 to 8 million cubic feet of natural gas and 500 to 800 barrels of oil daily.

Seitel said its 50 percent working interest (38 percent net revenue interest) in the Lange No. 2 well should generate net revenue of about $3.8 million during the first 12 months of production, based on the Seitel subsidiary's 50 percent interest) and current wellhead prices.
The well, located about 60 miles southwest of Houston, was tested into the sales line, the company said.

Other working-interest partners include Parallel Petroleum Corp 20 percent, Tenneco Inc 10 percent; privately held Cox & Perkins Exploration Inc, the operator, 10 percent. Unaffiliated individuals own the remaining 10 percent.
A number of other Yegua and Frio leads in Wharton County are scheduled to be drilled in coming months," Seitel said.
